title: How to Install Software in Red Hat Linux

steps.title: In Linux, software is often bundled in packages.
steps.content: In Linux, software is often bundled in packages. Packages make it easy to install software without having to compile the source code from scratch. You can install packages using a package manager, which is a tool that downloads the packages from repositories (repos) and installs them in a few easy steps. Package managers automatically resolve dependencies on other software libraries.

steps.title: Open a Terminal.
steps.content: Open a Terminal . You'll find Terminal in Applications > System Tools , or you can right-click the desktop and select Terminal .

steps.title: If you're installing system-wide software, you'll need administrative privileges.
steps.content: If you're installing system-wide software, you'll need administrative privileges. Type su - and type the root password when prompted.

steps.title: To get the latest software packages, you'll need to update the yum package manager.
steps.content: To get the latest software packages, you'll need to update the yum package manager. To do this, just type yum check-update and press Enter .

steps.title: Type yum install "program name" and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type yum install "program name" and press ↵ Enter . For example, to install the Dillo web browser, you would type yum install dillo .

steps.title: Press the Y key to start installing the software.
steps.content: Press the Y key to start installing the software. The software will now install. Once the installation is complete, you'll return to the command prompt.
